title: (x) John Kerry - Romana (pre-digital) {Mike Y}
content:
What is this?

We should do a presidential candidate font discussion!

 [‹ (x) SEGURA inc. clean sans - News Gothic {Adriano S, Franz}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203822/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3235 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Pointing hand dingbats - various {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203822/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3222 "Go to next forum topic")
author: matt_desmond

comments.content: Feels a bit like Nick Shinn
Treacyfaces' [Arrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203822/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/sample.html) has equally sharp serifs, but that's not it neither.
The font is Romana Ultra, as spotted under Spur Serifs in the Phil's Photo "Homage to the Alphabet " book, page 322. Image to follow.

Here is Romana Ultra from the Phil's Photo book. I checked MyFonts for the current Romana's and they are not the same. The 'r' and 'y' are what is not the same, so evidently this is some other foundry's version. The E+F and URW versions have the Ultra weight like a Bolded Bold, and the Ultra weight in Phil's book show definite character changes from the Bold. ![Phil's Romana Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203822im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26996.gif)
